intro: Acinos herba-barona, commonly known as the Spanish snowbell, is a low-growing perennial plant native to the Iberian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Capparaceae and is characterized by its small, white, bell-shaped flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant has hairy, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, round, green fruits that mature to a reddish hue. It thrives in rocky and calcareous soils, often found in alpine and subalpine regions. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and conservation areas.
